title: Air Gap
description: An air gap, air wall, air gapping or disconnected network is a network security measure employed on one or more computers to ensure that a secure computer network is physically isolated from unsecured networks, such as the public Internet or an unsecured local area network.
key-ideas: No physical connection (wired or wireless) connects the air-gapped network to any other device or network.
Considered the strongest possible network security measure, as it is impossible for a disconnected external network or Internet to access the network.
Air gap is only achieved by physically disconnecting a network - logical restrictions are not air gapped.
TEMPEST shielding or Farraday cages may be required to prevent wireless signals from coming in or out of a secure air gapped environment.
Does not protect against insider threats; physical security is required.
